importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date marks the latest update on the death toll and ongoing response efforts following the flooding event in Mexico.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The flooding event occurred over a period of time last week, with the peak rainfall and damage reported on Wednesday in Veracruz and Puebla.

keyTakeAways: At least 64 people have died in Mexico due to severe flooding caused by heavy rains across five states.
The National Civil Protection Coordination (CNPC) chief, Laura Velazquez Alzara, reported 65 people still missing.
Veracruz confirmed 29 deaths, Hidalgo 21, Puebla 13, and Queretaro 1.
43 people are missing in Hidalgo, 18 in Veracruz, and 4 in Puebla.
Over 100,000 houses have been affected, with some near rivers nearly disappearing.
The flooding was linked to remnants of Hurricane Priscilla and Tropical Rainstorm Raymond.
The heaviest rainfall was recorded in Cerro Azul (Veracruz) and Cuetzalan del Progreso (Puebla), with 280mm and 286mm respectively.
Thousands of military personnel from the Army, Air Force, and National Guard were deployed to deliver aid, including food and clean water.
Nearly 400 repair workers restored over 80% of the electricity supply, with about 263,000 users losing power.
President Claudia Sheinbaum expressed concern about the lack of early meteorological warnings indicating the severity of the rainfall.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Severe flooding in Mexico, caused by heavy rains from the remnants of Hurricane Priscilla and Tropical Rainstorm Raymond, has resulted in at least 64 deaths and 65 people still missing across five states. Veracruz reported the highest number of fatalities and affected homes, while Hidalgo and Puebla also saw significant damage. The heaviest rainfall occurred in Cerro Azul and Cuetzalan del Progreso. Thousands of military personnel and over 400 repair workers have been deployed to deliver aid and restore critical services, including electricity. The government has raised concerns about the lack of early warning systems, despite meteorological signs indicating the severity of the rainfall.
title: Mexico flooding death toll rises to 64, with dozens still missing
